trend_summary: Over the period the landscape stays overwhelmingly agricultural. Cropland consolidates into larger rectangular parcels, replacing scattered woodland and pasture, particularly north-central and near the looping river. A modestly denser road grid and a few new farmsteads appear, yet settlements remain tiny. Forested hills in the south endure with little disturbance.
notable_changes: Cropland parcels enlarged and regularised, reducing hedgerows and woodland fragments.
Visible loss of tree cover along the river meanders and some valley edges.
New straight access roads connect fields and link minor settlements.
Small clusters of farm buildings added, but no significant urban expansion.
